problem.p: A block of mass M is sliding down an inclined plane. The block's acceleration is parallel to the incline plane and it is pointing down. Which of the following statements are true?

li.p: The frictional force must be zero
The frictional force must be less than the component of Mg down the plane
The normal force of the plane is equal to the weight of the block
The surface may or may not have friction, even though the block is accelerating
If the block's mass were doubled, its acceleration would be doubled
